ygData.subject: RE: First trip to Unrest
ygData.msgSnippet: be ready for getting nuked alot. have guardian rythms and elemental rythms ready at all times because yes the hags still do hurt My party was bored this
ygData.messageBody:
be ready for getting nuked alot. have guardian rythms and elemental rythms
ready at all times because yes the hags still do hurt

My party was bored this weekend and we ended going to find out just where
the ghost spawns, we actually had to do an evac gate because everything just
got out of control for some odd reason and next thing you know the ghost
spawns on us. Needless to say all of a sudden our 2 bards were playing fear
song close to the gate casters hehe

our party was:
bard 31
bard 38
druid 39
cleric35
cleric37

but one thing that made the situation get out of hand here is that the druid
and one cleric had very big frame rate problems so they were rendered almost
useless. but we will go back and woop that dwarf some time.

Minkin
Sol Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Edward Scanni [SMTP:edwardscanni@...]
> Sent: September 11, 1999 12:57 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] First trip to Unrest
>
> From: "Edward Scanni" <edwardscanni@...>
>
> Hello all- believe it or not, at level 28 I have yet to travel to quite a
> few dungeons. Since I am currently in Kaladim, I thought I would give
> Unrest
> a try.
> My questions are this: what songs should i be using primarily-both as a
> battle bard and as a buff party bard?
> My current machime though is only a p233 and weaving more than 2 songs,
> maybe 3 on a good connection day, is about my max-2 being the norm for me.
> Any suggestions and tips would be greatly appreciated.
>
> Scanna Swiftsinger
> 28th Chorus
> Bertox Server
>
>
